How do the high conversion fees in Verus DeFi benefit the users of the platform?

The conversion fees in Verus DeFi are actually incredibly low, not high. When converting to and from a basket currency, the fee is 0.025%, and when converting from reserve to reserve currency, the fee is 0.05%. These fees go directly to the worldwide miners and stakers of the protocol, and/or they are accrued into the reserves making the basket currency worth more.

When a centralized version of this currency is created, the owner of the rootID can mint currencies into existence, while automatically lowering the reserve ratio. Or they can burn currencies and automatically raise the reserve ratio. Anyone can also just burn the currency at will without raising the reserve ratio.The conversion fees are incredibly low, 0.025% when converting to and from a basket currency, and 0.05% when converting from reserve to reserve currency. These fees go directly to the worldwide miners and stakers of the protocol, and/or they are accrued into the reserves making the basket currency worth more.| Conversion type | Fee | Fee goes to |
| :-----| :------ | :-------- |
| Basket currency ↔️ reserve | 0.025% | 0.0125% added to reserves of the basket currency, 0.0125% to the block reward for miners and stakers | 
| Reserve ↔️ reserve | 0.05% | 0.025% added to reserves of the basket currency, 0.025% to the block reward for miners and stakers |Because all currency conversions are solved simultaneously inside a block, giving all participants the same price, the protocol is MEV-free (no front-running, back-running, sandwich attacks etc.). The protocol doesn’t have any of the problems EVM-like account-based systems have. Verus DeFi is fair, cheap and has no rent-seekers.Every(!) currency and token on the Verus network (also mapped ERC-20s!), can be used as reserves for basket currencies. As you might start to understand now — basket currencies are unique currencies that can not be found anywhere else and offer an enormous amount of opportunities for value creation.
What is the main advantage of EVM-like account-based systems over Verus DeFi?

There is no advantage of EVM-like account-based systems over Verus DeFi. In fact, Verus DeFi is fair, cheap, and has no rent-seekers, whereas EVM-like account-based systems have problems that Verus DeFi does not.

Can only a limited set of currencies be used as reserves for basket currencies on the Verus network?
No, every currency and token on the Verus network, including mapped ERC-20s, can be used as reserves for basket currencies. This provides an enormous amount of opportunities for value creation.
